title: Apple vs FBI: Encryption Backdoor Resistance and Constitutional Implications (2016-2025)
description: Document Apple's resistance to FBI demands for encryption backdoors, the broader industry response, and how this established precedents for corporate resistance to government surveillance demands.
research_areas: How did Apple's resistance to FBI backdoor demands evolve from 2016-2025?
What specific legal arguments and technical explanations did Apple provide?
How did other tech companies respond to and coordinate with Apple's resistance?
What congressional and legal developments resulted from the encryption debates?
How have authoritarian governments exploited backdoor demands globally?
source_requirements: Court filings, corporate statements, FBI communications, congressional testimony, technical expert analyses
pdf_source: Technology Worker Resistance and Constitutional Cryptography_ Tools for Democratic Resilience.pdf
